data.name: label1.Text
data.value:
WINDOWS- EternalBlue (MS17-010) - This update patched a critical vulnerability in Microsoft's implementation of the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol. -The vulnerability was exploited by the WannaCry ransomware in 2017.
MacOS- macOS High Sierra Root Access Bug (CVE-2017-13872) - This update fixed a vulnerability that allowed anyone to log into an administrator account on macOS High Sierra without a password.
Spectre and Meltdown (CVE-2017-5753, CVE-2017-5715, CVE-2017-5754) - These updates addressed vulnerabilities in modern processors that could allow attackers to read sensitive information from memory.
macOS Mojave Supplemental Update (CVE-2019-8605) - This update fixed a vulnerability that could allow an application to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.
Zoom Vulnerability (CVE-2019-13450) - This update addressed a vulnerability in the Zoom video conferencing app that could allow a website to enable a Mac's camera without permission.
Gatekeeper Bypass (CVE-2020-9859) - This update addressed a vulnerability that could allow a maliciously crafted application to bypass Gatekeeper checks.
LINUX - Dirty Cow (CVE-2016-5195) - This update addressed a privilege escalation vulnerability in the Linux Kernel's memory subsystem that could allow a local user to gain root access.
BlueBorne (CVE-2017-1000251, CVE-2017-1000250, CVE-2017-0781, CVE-2017-0785) - These updates addressed vulnerabilities in the Bluetooth stack that could allow an attacker in close proximity to execute arbitrary code or launch a man-in-the-middle attack without user interaction.
Spectre and Meltdown (CVE-2017-5753, CVE-2017-5715, CVE-2017-5754) - These updates addressed vulnerabilities in modern processors that could allow attackers to read sensitive information from memory.
Shellshock (CVE-2014-6271, CVE-2014-7169) - This update addressed a vulnerability in the Bash shell that could allow remote code execution.
Grub2 BootHole (CVE-2020-10713, CVE-2020-14308) - This update addressed a vulnerability in the Grub2 bootloader that could allow an attacker to bypass Secure Boot and take control of the system.
Packet Injection Vulnerability (CVE-2021-3560) - This update addressed a privilege escalation vulnerability in the polkit authentication system that could allow a local unprivileged user to gain root privileges.
Sudo Vulnerability (CVE-2021-3156) - This update addressed a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the sudo utility that could allow a local unprivileged user to gain root privileges.
